DOC.brief_summary: Background The main risk factor cervical cancer infection human papillomavirus ( HPV ) , several intermediate step HPV infection cervical cancer . Cervical screen pap smear test HPV vaccination effective prevention . A high frequency HPV carriage cervical dysplasia describe transplanted woman . The majority woman cystic fibrosis reach adulthood face transplantation . Particular attention therefore pay cervical screening . However , low adherence screen recommendation note . In addition , preliminary data find high frequency abnormal smear inflammatory aspect cervix woman cystic fibrosis . Objectives study The main objective study determine prevalence HPV carriage cohort woman cystic fibrosis The secondary objective : - To study factor associate prevalence HPV ( transplantation , smoking , age first intercourse , number sexual partner year , contraception , gravidity parity , HPV vaccination ) - To describe compare data general population , hospital-based population , ( data transplant population transplant woman ) 1. prevalence HPV ( different genotype ) infection , cervical dysplasia , vulvar/vaginal/cervical condylomatosis 2. rate HPV persistence ( > 12 month ) , mean time HPV clearance ; rate spontaneous regression / persistence / worsen cervical dysplasia Study design : The study last 24 month . Includable patient adult woman , transplant , follow Lyon CRCM . Included woman attend consultation gynaecologist . Pap smear test ( liquid phase cytology ) genomic DNA microarray assay enable detection 35 different HPV genotype perform . Patients initial abnormal pap smear positive HPV test monitor : - In case abnormal smear / positive HPV test , pap smear HPV testing renew every 6 month study period - In case abnormal smear : Atypical squamous cell undetermined significance ( ASC-US ) : attitude depend result HPV test Atypical squamous cell - exclude HSI L ( ASC-H ) , Low-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion ( LSIL ) , High-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion ( HSIL ) , Atypical glandular cell undetermined significance ( AGUS ) , Atypical glandular cell ( AGC ) , Adenoma carcinoma situ ( AIS ) , carcinoma : colposcopy systematically perform Expected result This study help determine frequency HPV infection pathogenic power HPV non-transplanted transplanted woman cystic fibrosis This data help sensitize health professional importance gynecological care regular cervical screening , importance HPV vaccination . In case high frequency genital disease link HPV , recommendation gynecological monitoring procedure woman cystic fibrosis could evolve .
DOC.brief_title: Human Papillomavirus Cervical Dysplasia Women With Cystic Fibrosis
DOC.criteria: Female Cystic fibrosis Age 18 year older transplant nontransplanted Accepting principle gynecological consultation principle followup every 6 month case abnormal smear positive HPV test Patient cover health insurance Age 18 Refusal participate study Patient tutorship / curatorship
